content: LSU coach Brian Kelly didn't hold back in his postgame media availability following a 20-10 win over Florida that perhaps wasn't as glamorous as it could have been, telling reporters "I really don't care. We're trying to win football games."

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: "How Can He Do It": Union Minister Loses Cool At Karnataka Cop Over Lathicharge At Ganesh Procession
content: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday demanded the suspension of the senior police officer who ordered a lathi-charge on people who were part of the Ganesh idol immersion procession in Karnataka's Dharwad last week.

title: Missing Truck Driver Rescued From Sacked IAS Officer Puja Khedkar's Pune Home
content: A truck driver, missing after an accident with a car, has been traced to the Pune residence of sacked IAS officer Puja Khedkar, bringing fresh trouble for the former officer.

title: IndiGo Welcomes Its First All-Women Batch Of 33 Maintenance Technicians
content: IndiGo, India's preferred airline, marked the National Engineering Day by onboarding its first-ever all-women batch of 33 maintenance technicians.

title: Supreme Court To Rule On Pleas Against Waqf Amendment Act Tomorrow
content: The Supreme Court is slated to pronounce on Monday its interim orders on three key issues, including the power to denotify properties declared as "waqf by courts, waqf-by-user or waqf by deed."

title: Couple Dead, 3 Of Family Injured As Car Overturns In UP: Cops
content: A 60-year-old man and his wife died while three members of their family got injured after their car malfunctioned and overturned on the Delhi-Dehradun national highway in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Sunday, police said.

title: 'Have Courage To Question Islam?' BJP vs Siddaramaiah Over Conversion Remark
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's comment on conversion and the caste system in Hinduism has drawn a blistering response from the BJP, which quizzed him about equality in Islam and suggested that he "set aside" his "Leftist lens".

title: After Arrests Over Raipur 'Nude Party', Women's Commission Seeks Report
content: Police have arrested several suspected organisers after posters for an alleged "nude party" scheduled on 21 September in Chhattisgarh's Raipur went viral on social media.

title: "My Brain Is Worth Rs 200 Crore...:" Nitin Gadkari Slams Ethanol Policy Critics
content: Dismissing criticism against the government's ethanol-blended petrol programme as politically motivated, Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said that his brain "is worth Rs 200 crore a month" and he is not short of money.

title: Denial Of Marriage Post Consensual Physical Relationship Not An Offence: High Court
content: Merely refusal to get married by a man after a consensual physical relationship for four years would not constitute a cognisable offence, the Allahabad High Court has said while rejecting the plea of his live-in partner who had accused him of rape.

title: Man Arrested For Killing Toddler, Dumping Body In Hyderabad River: Cops
content: A man allegedly killed his two-and-a-half-year-old child and dumped the body in the Musi River here, police said on Sunday.

title: 21 Seats Across 7 Districts: The Nepal Violence Effect On Bihar Polls
content: The political upheaval in Nepal has affected the border districts if Bihar, where trade has hit rock bottom. It has also affected families, with grooms and brides often being found on the other side of the border.

title: PM Modi At 75: From G20 Leadership To Vaccine Diplomacy, India On Global Stage
content: Over his decade-long leadership, the country has played an active role in the G20, BRICS, while managing key ties with the United States.

title: 12-Year-Old Boy Takes Own Life After Mother Scolds Him In UP: Cops
content: A 12-year-old boy allegedly took his own life in the Manpur area of Moradabad district after being scolded by his mother, police said on Sunday.

title: Operation Sindoor Bravehearts Rebuild Lives At Pune Artificial Limb Centre
content: Corporal Varun Kumar, a paramedic with the Indian Air Force, lost his right hand when an enemy missile struck a first-aid post at the forward location of Udhampur airbase during Operation Sindoor.

title: Priya Sachdev Kapur Makes 1st Appearance After Husband Sunjay Kapur's Death
content: In her first appearance since her husband and industrialist Sunjay Kapur's death, Priya Sachdev Kapur attended the Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India meet.

title: An ATM Card vs Chequebook Battle Amid War Of Promises In Poll-Bound Bihar
content: Posters and pamphlets are passe, and an ATM card vs chequebook battle is playing out in Bihar's poll arena as political parties explore creative ways to showcase their promises to voters.

title: Delhi Man Found Dead In Hotel Room After Party With Friends, Family Claims Murder
content: A man died at a hotel in northeast Delhi after partying with his friends, police said on Sunday. The deceased's family suspects that he was drugged and killed during the party.

title: Trinamool Ex-MP Mimi Chakraborty, Actor Urvashi Rautela Summoned In Betting App Case
content: Trinamool ex MP Mimi Chakraborty, actor Urvashi Rautela have been asked by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to appear before them in connection with an alleged illegal betting app case.

title: Odisha teacher suspended for beating up 31 students for not touching her feet
content: ‚ÄúStudents were beaten with a bamboo stick. I personally found several with bruises on their hands. One child had to be given first aid, and a girl even lost consciousness briefly,‚Äù says Block Education Officer, who conducted inquiry

title: Ambiguity over Mamkootathil‚Äôs Assembly attendance
content: Speaker says there is no word on whether Mamkootathil will attend the Assembly. Congress leaders equivocal over the MLA‚Äôs presence in House. LDF places onus on Congress

content: Parliamentary Standing Committee on Communications and Information Technology also recommends mandatory labelling of AI-generated content and stronger measures against deepfakes

title: Residents, farmers oppose proposed Indosol, BPCL projects in Nellore district
content: Bharatha Chaitanya Yuvajana chief Ramachandra Yadav announces to go on a hunger strike along with the farmers if there is an attempt to grab their lands in Karedu

title: Priyanka seeks explanation over death of Congress functionaries
content: As many as four people committed suicide over the last two years allegedly due to factionalism within the party

title: Sena (UBT) stages protests against India-Pak Asia Cup cricket match

content: Ayyanna Patrudu raises concern over absenteeism in Andhra Pradesh Assembly, noting 11 YSRCP MLAs, including the party leader, frequently skip sessions

title: Kerala Police‚Äôs cybersecurity summit to focus on prevention of child abuse
content: Kochi will host the conference on October 10 and 11. Ahead of the meet, a 10-day training will be given for investigation officers of cyber units from all States at the Kerala Police Academy.

title: 1,500 tonnes of onion sold at auction in Kurnool
content: Anticipating huge arrival of onions to the market on September 15, authorities have declared closure of the market yard on September 16 to avoid inconvenience to the farmers

content: Haritha Keralam Mission initiative to create green islets and mini forests on unused land.  Local bodies, schools, colleges and other institutions have participated in the campaign

title: Can consider anticipatory bail pleas even if litigants approach it directly, says Kerala HC
content: The Supreme Court had said that the High Court would be flooded with a spate of pre-arrest bail applications if litigants approached it directly. It cited. It cited precedents, including by the top court regarding the matter.

content: Many rivulets in spate on A.P.-Telangana borders, police arranging boats, dial 112 in case of emergency, say police

title: India needs to invest more in accelerating diversification of food production: FAO Chief Economist
content: Maximo Torero Cullen wants India to move from cereals to high-value commodities; pulses could be an option because ‚Äòthey are more nutritious, they also have proteins‚Äô

title: Calicut varsity allows students to pick minor courses from allied disciplines
content: The order issued by the Vice-Chancellor on September 11 states that colleges are permitted to offer minor courses from allied disciplines, regardless of whether these are offered as major programmes in the institutions

title: Fee reimbursement dues: private colleges in Telangana to shut down indefinitely from Monday
content: Engineer‚Äôs Day to be observed as Black Day; private colleges urge government to come out with a comprehensive policy to address admissions, fee reimbursement, and fee fixation in consultation with managements

title: Three-phase mitigation campaign to tackle human-wildlife conflict set to begin in Kerala
content: In the first phase from September 16 to 30, help desks will be opened at all forest range and panchayat offices located in forest-fringe areas where public can file complaints  regarding crop loss, delayed compensation, safety threats and other difficulties caused by wild animal incursions

title: Watch: This India vs Pakistan Match Is Different | Here‚Äôs Why
content: India and Pakistan meet in Dubai for their first international cricket match since the Pahalgam terror attacks and Operation Sindoor. The game comes amid political tensions, calls for a sporting boycott and government restrictions on bilateral series.¬†

title: Tree census to be conducted in the city to assess green cover
content: A tree census will be conducted in the city to measure and map its green cover at a time when Mysuru is witnessing rapid urbanisation and horizontal sprawl resulting in erosion of lung space

title: Two-day Collectors‚Äô conference begins in Andhra Pradesh on September 15
content: Welfare programmes, Super Six schemes, Anna Canteens, P4 initiative, Quantum Valley, RTIH, and WhatsApp-based citizen services will form key areas of discussion during the conference

title: Funded by World Bank loan, Bengaluru Water Resilience Project to be GBA‚Äôs first undertaking
content: Under its Programme-for-Results financing, the World Bank has approved a loan of $426 million (approximately ‚Çπ3,500 crore) for the Bengaluru Water Resilience Project

title: Bengaluru bus commuters flag tracking issues on BMTC app with new electric AC, airport buses
content: The Namma BMTC app, launched in 2023, has been an important app for city commuters; currently, it allows real-time tracking of 6,245 buses, helping passengers plan their journeys more efficiently.¬†

title: Massive devotee rush in Guruvayur on Sree Krishna Jayanti
content: Temple town overflows with little Krishnas at Thrissur. Around 1,050 Shobha Yatras held in the district

title: Sale of Dasara special puja tickets begins at Kanaka Durga temple in Vijayawada
content: Tickets are available for in-person and virtual participation for major pujas. Devotees can book through the temple website, WhatsApp, or counters, with strict guidelines for travel and attire

title: Kerala Assembly likely to witness a clash between controversies
content: The House, which convenes for the final time before the local body elections, will serve as a platform for the rival alliances to present their cases to the electorate

title: Kozhikode City police step up probe into long-pending missing-person cases
content: After successfully resolving two high-profile cases in just three months, which were later found to be murders, investigations led by separate police squads under senior officers have now entered a more structured phase with close monitoring by the District Police Chief (Kozhikode City)

title: 350 public schools will be set up in Kalyana Karnataka, says Ajay Singh
content: He says that Cabinet has cleared a proposal for constructing 500 public schools in the State with assistance from the Asian Development Fund

title: 'Lived for 33 years in US': Punjabi grandmother detained by ICE; community outraged
content: A 73-year-old Punjabi grandmother, Harjit Kaur, a long-time Bay Area resident, has been detained by ICE, sparking outrage in her community. For 13 years, Kaur regularly checked in with immigration officials. Her family states she has no criminal record and has always paid taxes. Congressman John Garamendi has intervened, criticizing the Trump administration's immigration policies.

title: Israel's Qatar strike: Mossad refused to take part in ops - here's why
content: Mossad refused a ground operation targeting Hamas leaders in Doha. Israel opted for airstrikes. The strike aimed at key Hamas figures. However, it reportedly killed relatives, aides, and a Qatari officer. Internal conflict arose over the strike's timing. Some feared it would derail hostage negotiations. Israel cited a rare opportunity and recent attacks as reasons for the operation.

title: Pak anthem blunder! Hilarious mishap stuns Dubai - Watch
content: The Asia Cup 2025 match between India and Pakistan faced an unexpected start in Dubai due to an anthem mix-up, causing visible confusion among Pakistani players. Hardik Pandya's historic first-ball wicket added to the drama after Pakistan won the toss and chose to bat. India capitalized on early momentum with key wickets, intensifying pressure on Pakistan's top order.

title: Gemini Nano Banana AI Saree: What it this new trend; How can you create photos
content: Following the Nano Banana AI 3D figurine craze, the 'Banana AI Saree' trend has emerged on Instagram. Users are transforming selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits using Google‚Äôs Gemini Nano Banana image editing tool. The AI crafts images with chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, mimicking classic Bollywood aesthetics with popular styles like polka-dot and floral sarees.

title: Watch: Fired-up! Gambhir turns up the heat in pre-match huddle
content: Ahead of the high-stakes India-Pakistan T20 Asia Cup clash, coach Gautam Gambhir delivered a passionate pep talk, emphasizing pride and resilience. Pakistan opted to bat first, citing familiarity with the slow Dubai wicket. Political tensions lingered, evident in the absence of a handshake, but Gambhir's fiery words underscored the importance of mentality in this intense rivalry.

title: Ricky Hatton cause of death: How did the English boxing legend die at 46
content: Ricky "The Hitman" Hatton, a celebrated British boxer, has died at 46. Police discovered his body at his home in Hyde, Greater Manchester, confirming no suspicious circumstances. The news arrives shortly after Hatton announced a comeback fight in Dubai, leaving the boxing world in mourning for the beloved champion who battled both inside and outside the ring.

title: Amazon suspends engineer: Sent 'threatening' letter to CEO Andy Jassy
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Fact check: Are heart attacks caused by bacterial infections?
content: A viral post suggests bacterial infections, particularly biofilms, may trigger heart attacks by causing inflammation and plaque rupture. Research indicates oral bacteria, like viridans group Streptococci, are found in arterial plaques of heart attack victims. Scientists are investigating how these biofilms activate and contribute to plaque destabilization and thrombus formation, potentially linking oral health to cardiovascular disease. Read more below!

title: Asia Cup: Record! Pak batter becomes first-ever to achieve rare feat against Bumrah
content: In a stunning display of power hitting, Sahibzada Farhan etched his name in history by becoming the first Pakistani batter to hit Jasprit Bumrah for a six in T20Is, achieving this feat twice during their Asia Cup clash. Farhan's aggressive counterattack helped his team shift momentum momentarily, marking a significant moment in the high-stakes encounter.

title: Google sued again: Major US publisher files lawsuit; AI Search feature hit
content: Penske Media, owner of Rolling Stone and Variety, is suing Google for using its content without permission in AI Overviews. The lawsuit alleges that these AI-generated summaries decrease website traffic and advertising revenue for publishers. Penske claims Google's dominance forces consent, leading to a decline in traffic and affiliate revenue.

title: Hulk Hogan's family desperately begged him to avoid neck surgery. But why?
content: Hulk Hogan's family, including his wife Sky Daily, cautioned him against undergoing a risky neck surgery in May 2025, fearing his active lifestyle would hinder recovery. Despite warnings, Hogan proceeded and quickly resumed public appearances, potentially exacerbating his condition. His health rapidly declined, leading to his death from a heart attack, with his widow now considering a medical malpractice lawsuit.

title: Asia Cup: SKY refuses handshake with Pak captain! What happened?
content: Salman Agha, Pakistan's captain, chose to bat first after winning the toss against India in the Asia Cup. The captains did not shake hands, creating tension. Pakistan aims to set a target, despite past trends favoring chasing in Dubai. India preferred to bowl, anticipating dew. Both teams selected spin-heavy squads.

title: IND vs PAK: Hands folded! Hardik Pandya gets emotional during national anthem
content: During the India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash, Hardik Pandya's emotional rendition of the national anthem highlighted the match's significance beyond cricket, intensified by recent diplomatic tensions following the Pahalgam attack. Pakistan chose to bat, while India aimed to leverage dew during their chase. The captains' refrained handshake further underscored the strained relationship, emphasizing the profound emotions intertwined with this sporting rivalry.

title: Who is Claire Sweeney? Ricky Hatton‚Äôs ex-girlfriend and Coronation Street star
content: Claire Sweeney, known for Coronation Street, and boxer Ricky Hatton had a romance after meeting on Dancing on Ice. Their friendship of 25 years surprised many. They kept their relationship private initially, dating and vacationing in Tenerife. Though brief, their connection was significant. News of Ricky Hatton's death at 46 has brought their relationship back into focus.

title: Corn in the USA: Lutnick says buy it or else; gives dire warning to India
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is escalating trade tensions with India, threatening market access unless it buys US corn. Despite India's self-sufficiency and concerns over genetically-modified crops, Lutnick accuses India of unfair trade practices. This hardline stance, criticized by some as misrepresentative, risks straining relations even where accommodation is possible, as trade disputes continue.

title: Irony! Anti-immigrant protesters at UK rally feast on Indian onion bhaji - watch
content: A large far-right rally in Britain, marred by violence and arrests, saw anti-immigration protesters ironically enjoying Indian food. The demonstration, attended by over 100,000 people, featured anti-immigrant rhetoric and speeches from far-right figures. Clashes with police resulted in numerous injuries and arrests, highlighting the event's contentious nature.

title: Charlie Kirk's killing: Trump takes on new role; what is his 'radical' message?
content: Following Charlie Kirk's death, President Trump has taken a prominent role, announcing details and blaming the "radical left" without evidence. This response, marked by direct communication and government recognition, contrasts with typical protocol. While supporters welcome his style, critics fault his rhetoric for potentially influencing the investigation and exacerbating political divisions amid rising violence.

title: Students & factories: How Russia took over Ukraine's skies ‚Äî Inside Putin's drone war
content: Russia's drone warfare has escalated dramatically, with increased production and incursions into NATO airspace. Factories, students, and foreign assistance fuel Moscow's ability to launch massive drone swarms, overwhelming Ukrainian defenses. These attacks are no longer sporadic but continuous, posing a significant challenge to Kyiv and raising concerns about NATO's vulnerability to similar assaults.

title: Asia Cup: Dubai on high alert for India-Pak - Rs 7 lakh fine, jail penalty
content: Dubai authorities have announced strict measures for spectators attending the highly anticipated India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 match. Major General Al Mazrouei emphasized that specialized police units will be deployed to ensure security and address any disruptions decisively. Violators could face imprisonment and hefty fines ranging from AED5,000 to AED30,000 for offenses like pitch invasions or possessing prohibited items.

title: No Kohli, Rohit! BCCI announces India A squad for Oz series; two captains named
content: The BCCI has announced the India A squads for the upcoming three-match one-day series against Australia A in Kanpur. Rajat Patidar will lead in the first match, while Tilak Varma will captain the subsequent games. The squads feature young talents from domestic cricket and the IPL, with Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana joining for the final two matches.

title: India-Pak match draws ire: Oppn terms it betrayal of martyrs; govt responds
content: The India-Pakistan Asia Cup match in Dubai has ignited political controversy, with opposition parties condemning it as insensitive after the Pahalgam terror attack, while the government defends it as a sporting event separate from political tensions.

title: Boxing legend Ricky Hatton passes away after announcing surprise comeback
content: Ricky Hatton, the beloved "Hitman" and British boxing icon, tragically passed away at his home at the age of 46. Just weeks before, he had announced a comeback fight in Dubai, generating excitement among fans. Hatton, a two-weight world champion, retired in 2012 but remained active in boxing as a promoter and trainer.

title: Emmanuel Acho blasted: Charlie Kirk row; Joe Burrow Foundation drops member
content: Emmanuel Acho is under fire for spreading inaccurate claims about Charlie Kirk in viral TikTok and YouTube videos, refusing to correct them even after backlash. At the same time, the Joe Burrow Foundation cut ties with Hamilton County Judge Ted Berry, removing him from its board over remarks following Kirk‚Äôs assassination at Utah Valley University.

title: Asia Cup: Beating India? Pakistan urged to 'push 10‚Äì20% extra' by Panesar
content: Monty Panesar has declared India as favorites in their upcoming Asia Cup clash against Pakistan in Dubai, citing India's balanced team composition. Despite tense political relations and the absence of key veterans like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for India, and Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan for Pakistan, both teams have started strongly with convincing victories in the tournament.

title: Metaverse, AI & drones: Terrorists exploiting emerging tech; Quad's new priority
content: Despite summit uncertainties, Quad nations are actively pursuing counterterrorism efforts, including workshops addressing drone misuse and the exploitation of emerging technologies by terrorists. India acknowledges US commitment to the Quad, even amidst evolving US-China relations. The group will also launch its Ports of the Future Partnership, highlighting ongoing cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Online betting app case: ED summons actor Urvashi Rautela, ex-MP Mimi Chakraborty
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned actress Urvashi Rautela as part of its money laundering investigation into the online betting platform 1xBet. This action follows similar summonses issued to other celebrities, including cricketer Shikhar Dhawan and Suresh Raina.

title: Viral video: Mike Tyson floors MrBeast with knockout punch at Canelo v Crawford
content: Before the Canelo √Ålvarez vs. Terence Crawford fight in Las Vegas, MrBeast was punched in the stomach by Mike Tyson for entertainment. The video quickly went viral, sparking debate online. Later that night, Crawford defeated √Ålvarez in twelve rounds to become the undisputed super middleweight champion. Crawford's victory came as a shock during Mexico‚Äôs Independence weekend, solidifying his legacy.

title: Is black seed oil effective in reducing inflammation? Here's what research said
content: Emerging research suggests black seed oil, containing thymoquinone, effectively reduces joint inflammation, rivaling NSAIDs like ibuprofen. Clinical trials demonstrate pain relief and improved function in osteoarthritis patients with oral or topical application. Studies also reveal anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits, indicating its potential as a safe, natural pain management option.

title: 'We don't plan wars': China hits back at Trump's threat; slams US appeal to Nato
content: China's foreign minister Wang Yi has responded to US calls for Nato to impose hefty tariffs on Beijing over its alleged support for Russia in the Ukraine war, reiterating China's commitment to peace talks and multilateralism. Trump proposed tariffs of 50-100% on China, claiming it would pressure Russia to end the conflict.

title: Suicidal thoughts? Shami on darkest phase of life: 'Socha zaroor, par hua nahin'
content: Indian fast bowler Mohammed Shami revealed he contemplated suicide during a difficult period marked by personal and professional struggles. He credited his love for cricket and the support from fans for preventing him from taking that step. Shami has faced criticism and allegations in recent years, impacting his form and leading to his exclusion from the Asia Cup squad.

title: Assam: PM Modi hits out at Congress, Nehru; accuses party of backing terrorists over Army
content: During his Assam visit, Prime Minister Modi criticized Nehru's handling of the 1962 Chinese aggression, claiming Assam still suffers. He contrasted Congress's limited infrastructure development with his government's construction of six Brahmaputra bridges in the last decade. Modi accused Congress of supporting infiltrators and insulting Bhupen Hazarika.

title: Punjab: SAD leader's son dies in road accident in Jalandhar; CM Mann expresses grief
content: Richi Kaypee, son of SAD leader Mohinder Singh Kaypee, tragically died in a road accident in Jalandhar on Saturday night. His SUV was struck by a speeding vehicle near Mata Rani Chowk, also impacting two other vehicles. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and SAD president Sukhbir Singh Badal expressed their condolences to the Kaypee family.

title: Asia Cup: Suniel Shetty backs India playing Pakistan - 'You can't blame anybody'
content: Amid calls to boycott the India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash following the Pahalgam terror attack, Suniel Shetty emphasized that cricketers shouldn't be blamed for playing, as they represent the country under international sporting regulations. Fielding coach Ryan ten Doeschate echoed this, stating the team is focused on the game, adhering to BCCI and government directives, while acknowledging public sentiment.

title: Will Moore play against Detroit Lions tonight? Here's the answer
content: DJ Moore is set to play in tonight's NFC North showdown against the Detroit Lions, boosting the Chicago Bears' offense. As rookie quarterback Caleb Williams faces his first divisional road test, Moore's presence as the top wide receiver is crucial. Moore's chemistry with Williams and ability to stretch the field make him a focal point in Chicago's passing game.

title: Tyreek Hill faces suspension as women‚Äôs group challenges over domestic violence probe
content: NFL star Tyreek Hill faces fresh domestic abuse allegations from his wife, Keeta Vaccaro, who detailed multiple violent incidents in divorce papers. Despite the charges, Hill is expected to play against the Patriots, sparking outrage. The National Organization for Women demands his immediate suspension, criticizing the NFL's handling of violence against women.

title: From zones to family attractions- What‚Äôs new this year in Riyadh season
content: Riyadh Season 2025 will begin in October, bringing an exciting mix of world-class sports, music, and cultural events, including the debut Riyadh Comedy Festival and the return of the Six Kings Slam tennis tournament. Aligned with Saudi Vision 2030, it emphasizes Arabic talent and international collaborations, further establishing Riyadh as a vibrant global hub for entertainment and culture.

title: 'Op Sindoor a waste': Pahalgam victim slams India vs Pak match
content: The scheduled Asia Cup 2025 India-Pakistan cricket match in Dubai faces strong opposition from Indian fans following the Pahalgam terror attack, which resulted in civilian casualties. Families of victims express their grief and question the decision to proceed with the match despite the recent Operation Sindoor and cross-border tensions.

title: News: Jose Altuve leaves game early; Tarik Skubal sees good test results
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the new york Yankees will try to sweep the weekend set from the Boston Red Sox at Fenway Park . sportsmail's "sunday night baseball" returns with two familiar foes hooking up .

title: Latest CFP, bowl projections: Fallout from another wild weekend
content: the college football landscape has seen its share of tumultuous results . two teams near the top of most preseason playoff projections -- Notre Dame and Clemson -- already have two losses . the SEC looks as deep and strong as ever based on its nonconference record .

title: After defeating Canelo, is Crawford the best fighter of his generation?
content: Terence Crawford becomes undisputed champion in three weight classes . the 37-year-old beats canelo alvarez unanimously to become super middleweight champion . he enters an exclusive club as the first men's boxer in the four-belt era to earn undisputed status .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the 2025 WNBA playoffs open Sunday . all eight teams are in action, with the no. 1 seed Minnesota Lynx taking on the expansion franchise Golden State Valkyries . the red-hot Las Vegas Aces host the Seattle Storm .

content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . this guide should help you with all sorts of decision-making, including sit/start decisions, last-minute waiver adds and lineup choices .

title: Vikings' classic uniforms, Bengals' orange tops NFL Week 2 threads
content: the Vikings will be the first team to rock throwback uniforms in week 2 of the new season . the look borrows design elements from some of the earliest uniforms with a deeper purple than the modern version . for the second straight season, the Cincinnati Bengals are rocking orange jerseys .

title: Your guide to Sunday's first-round WNBA playoff games: Matchups, storylines, more
content: the best-of-three first round opens Sunday with four games . the top four seeds have home-court advantage, but the road teams are looking to steal a Game 1 win . defending champion new york Liberty also hit hard by injuries .

title: Best of Week 3: The SEC's top Dawg, a new ACC contender and a game-changing win for Texas A&M
content: defending defending champions Georgia drew 44-41 at the king . it was a revelation that the ACC might, too . a false start flag pushed the kick back 5 yards and Gilbert's boot never came close to the uprights .

title: UCLA fires coach Foster after Bruins start 0-3
content: UCLA  has fired coach DeShaun Foster after he started his second season as coach 0-3, the school announced Sunday. An impressive class in the transfer portal, including the addition of former Tennessee quarterback  Nico Iamaleava , seemed like a solid foundation for Year 2 of Foster, who rallied the Bruins to post victories in four out the last six games to end last season. But the season couldn't have started off any worse. In the Rose Bowl, on opening might, the Bruins fell to Utah, 43-10. A week later, at UNLV, they stumbled again, dropping a 30-23 decision. But those losses were just lead-ins to a puzzling 35-10 defeat at the hands of New Mexico in Week 3 at the Rose Bowl. The Bruins, through three weeks, did not top 23 points in any game, and had allowed at least 30 in all three losses. Foster had a 5-10 record in the 15 games he coached for the Bruins.
